result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnya M Goetz #327317 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No Contact with victims J.S., P.H., Walmart (Rib Mountain), Fleet Farm, Kwik Trip (Wausau and Rib Mountain) and IGA (Rib Mountain).
Absolute Sobriety.

Random UA's
Assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Good Faith effort to maintain FTE/School.

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid through extended supervision as previously assessed.

Counseling.  Good faith effort to obtain and maintain FTE and/or schooling.
J&S to be paid at the rate of 25% of prison wages with the remainder to be paid on Extended Supervision.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 4:06pm. Clerk: Denise.  INCLUDES 14CF81, 14CF166, 14CF445, 14CF856. State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Matter set for SAR 14CF81 & 14CF166. State recites agreement. COURT addresses State on recommendation. Statements by State & Defense. Defendant makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS 14CF81 - WI State Prison Total of 3 yr & 6 months; Initial Confinement 1 yr & 6 months; Extended Supervision 2 yrs. 311 day credit. Concurrent to each other. 
COURT ORDERS 14CF166 - WI State Prison Total of 4 yrs; Initial Confinement 2 yr; Extended Supervision 2 yrs. 50 days credit. Concurrent to each other and Consecutive to 14CF81. 
EXTENDED SUPERVISION CONDITIONS: Counseling; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Restitution Joint & Several with Co-defendant J.T. in the amount of $4,342.19; to be paid at the rate of 25% of prison wages with the remainder to be paid on Extended Supervision. Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Court remands Defendant to Marathon Cty Sheriff to be transported to prison setting. Copy of CR 234 given to Defendant after Court. COURT has signed Restitution Order. Adjourned: 4:23pm. BOTR @ 4:24pm. COURT notes that Sentence is also concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. Adjourned: 4:23pm. CLERK AMENDS MINUTES ON 5/21/15 @ 12:00PM.
ad Prosequendum
returned on 04-26-2015

Includes: 14CF81, 14CF166, 14CF445 and 14CF856
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Def appears in custody with Atty James Kurszewski.
Atty Kurszewski files a Waiver of Prelim in 14CF856, ADA Puerner states that they charges in 14CF856 will be DRI so the Court does not need to do a preliminary hearing. Court agrees.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to: 14CF81>>Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5>>DRI

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
Arguments on conditional jail time.
COURT ORDERS: WS: Probation for 5 years (concurrent) with Conditions of: 14CF81>Count 1>>Conditional 6 months MCJ w/Huber for work or treatment and credit for 125 days. Further conditions: NC with victim JS, PH, Walmart/Rib Mtn, Fleet Farm, Kwik Trip/Wausau  & Rib Mtn and IGA Rib Mtn. AODA, absolute sobriety, random UA's, assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent, good faith effort to maintain FTE/School, CC (includes new surcharge), DNA sample and surcharge. No restitution requests.
